Byte.Name: FileCorrelationStatus
Byte.summary: Represents correlation status of a file.

Member.Name: Dissociated
Member.summary: File has been added to the database or modified and needs to be analyzed.

Member.Name: PendingValidation
Member.summary: Acknowledged; Validation in progress.

Member.Name: Deferred
Member.summary: Final determination deferred.

Member.Name: Analyzing
Member.summary: Correlations to other files are being established.

Member.Name: Correlated
Member.summary: File has been compared with all other files with the same Hash. Final disposition pending.

Member.Name: Justified
Member.summary: File duplicaton is justified.

Member.Name: Insupportable
Member.summary: Indicates that the files should be deleted.

Member.Name: Violation
Member.summary: Elevated status for unauthorized copies of files that need further attention.

Member.Name: Attrition
Member.summary: Indicates that the file has been scheduled/tasked to be deleted, but not yet confirmed.

Member.Name: Deleted
Member.summary: The file has been deleted.

Member.Name: NotRunning
Member.summary: File system crawl is not running.

Member.Name: InProgress
Member.summary: File system crawl is in progress.

Member.Name: Completed
Member.summary: File system crawl ranto completion.

Member.Name: AllottedTimeElapsed
Member.summary: File system was stopped prior to completion because the alotted execution duration had been reached.

Member.Name: MaxItemCountReached
Member.summary: File system was stopped prior to completion because the maximum number of items had been processed.

Member.Name: Canceled
Member.summary: File system crawl was manually canceled before completion.

Member.Name: Failed
Member.summary: File system crawl was aborted due to a failure.

Member.Name: Disabled
Member.summary: File system crawl configuration is disabled.

EntityType.Name: IDbEntity

DateTime.remarks: For local databases, this value is the system- date and time. For upstream (remote) databases, this is the UTC date and time.

DateTime.Name: ModifiedOn

DateTime.remarks: For local databases, this value is the system- date and time. For upstream (remote) databases, this is the UTC date and time.

EntityType.summary: Specifies the configuration of a file system crawl.

Guid.value: The unique identifier used as the current entity's primary key the database.

VarChar.value: The display name for the current crawl configuration.

DateTime.summary: Gets the date and time when the last crawl was started.

DateTime.Name: LastCrawlEnd
DateTime.summary: Gets the date and time when the last crawl was finshed.
DateTime.value: The date and time when the last crawl was finshed; otherwise, if the current crawl is still active or if no crawl has ever been started for this configuration.

DateTime.summary: Gets the date and time when the next true is to begin.

Int64.summary: Gets the length of time between automatic crawl re-scheduling.

Boolean.Name: RescheduleFromJobEnd
Boolean.summary: Gets a value indicating whether automatic rescheduling is calculated from the completion time of the previous job, versus the start time.

Boolean.Name: RescheduleAfterFail
Boolean.summary: Gets a value indicating whether crawl jobs are automatically rescheduled even if the previous job failed.
Boolean.value: if crawl jobs are always automatically re-scheduled; otherwise, if crawl jobs are automatically re-scheduled only if the preceding job did not fail.

Member.Name: None
Member.summary: No application roles.

Member.Name: Reader
Member.summary: Read-only application access.

Member.Name: Auditor
Member.summary: Extended read-only application access for auditing purposes.

Member.Name: Contributor
Member.summary: User can read and write file system crawl results for their own shared crawl results as well as read and write task records.

Member.Name: ITSupport
Member.summary: User can read and write all file system crawl results and task records.

Member.Name: ChangeAdministrator
Member.summary: User can assign manual remediation tasks as well as determine desired state.
Member.remarks: This role implies the privileges of the and roles as well.

Member.Name: AppAdministrator
Member.summary: User can make changes to most application settings.
Member.remarks: This role implies the privileges of the , and roles as well.

Member.Name: SystemAdmin
Member.summary: User can make changes to all application settings as well as the ability to read and write all records.

Byte.Name: TaskStatus
Byte.summary: Represent the status of a task.

Member.Name: New
Member.summary: Task has not been acknowledged.

Member.Name: Open
Member.summary: Task has been acknowledged, but not yet started.

Member.Name: Active
Member.summary: Task is currently being addressed.

Member.Name: Pending
Member.summary: Task is in a paused state, pending some other factor.

Member.Name: Canceled
Member.summary: Task has been canceled.

Member.Name: Completed
Member.summary: Task has been completed.

Byte.Name: PriorityLevel
Byte.summary: Represents the priority level of a task.

Member.Name: Deferred
Member.summary: Task has been deferred to a later date.

Member.Name: Critical
Member.summary: Task has the highest priority.

Member.Name: High
Member.summary: Task has elevated priority.

Member.Name: Normal
Member.summary: Task has normal priority.

Member.Name: Low
Member.summary: Task has low priority.

Member.Name: Unknown
Member.summary: Host platform type is unknown.

Member.Name: Windows
Member.summary: Host machine runs on a Windows-based operating system.

Member.Name: Linux
Member.summary: Host machine runs on a Linux-based operating system.

Member.Name: OSX
Member.summary: Host machine runs on a OSX-based operating system.

Member.Name: Android
Member.summary: Host is an android device.

Member.Name: IOS
Member.summary: Host is an IOS device.
